questions.text: A 57-year-old man with known very severe COPD who continues to smoke cigarettes presents to his doctor with increasing weight gain and bilateral lower leg edema over several weeks. On examination, he has an elevated jugular venous pulsation and bilateral lower leg edema that extend to his knees. An electrocardiogram shows right ventricular hypertrophy and right axis deviation. Which of the following is the most appropriate diagnostic test at this time?

options.label: B
options.text: CT scan of the chest without contrast

questions.text: The following are main diagnostic criteria for Allergic Bronchopulmonary Aspergillosis EXCEPT

63-year-old man is evaluated for worsening dyspnea on exertion over an 18-month period. He is a retired teacher with a 30-year history of smoking. His spirometry reveals an FEV1 59% predicted, FVC 78% predicted, and FEV1/FVC ratio 0.62 with no response to inhaled bronchodilators. A chest radiograph demonstrates large lung volumes, a large retrosternal airspace, and flat diaphragms. Which of the following would most likely be seen on further pulmonary function testing in this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Increased diffusing capacity for carbon monoxide

questions.text: All are predisposing factors of ARDS except ?

A 48-year-old man is brought into the emergency department with decreased level of consciousness. An arterial blood gas shows pH 7.28, PaCO2 26, PaO2 62, and H CO 3? 12. Which of the following could account for the observed abnormalities on his blood gases?
Which of the following is true for transudative pleural effusions ?
questions.correct_answer: C. Usually due to infective etiology

questions.text: A 66-year-old woman complains of dyspnea on exertion over a several month period. Her pulmonary function tests show an FEV1/FVC ratio of 0.83, TLC 65% predicted, and a diffusing capacity for carbon monoxide of 53% predicted. A CT pulmonary angiogram shows no evidence of pulmonary embolism. 2D ECHO was normal . Which of the following diagnoses could account for the findings on her evaluation thus far?
A 40-year-old alcoholic develops cough and fever. Chest x-ray shows an air-fluid level in the superior segment of the right lower lobe. The most likely etiologic agent is

A 59-year-old woman with asthma presents to the emergency department after developing the sudden onset of pleuritic left-sided chest pain and dyspnea. While she is being evaluated, she develops worsening dyspnea, tachycardia, and hypotension. On exam, her neck veins are distended, her trachea is deviated to the right, and she has absent breath sounds on the left side of her chest. Which of the following interventions is indicated at this time?

options.label: D
options.text: Needle decompression of the left chest

questions.correct_answer: D. Needle decompression of the left chest

questions.text: The most common life threatening metabolic complication of squamous cell carcinoma of lung is

A 30 year previously healthy male came with 2 days fever and cough with purulent sputum. Examination reveals an impaired note with bronchial breathing and crackles and increased vocal resonance. He is alert. BP=100/70. Respiratory rate =24/min. Blood urea=20 mg%. Which of the following is the best treatment for him?

options.label: A
options.text: OP treatment with Clarithromycin 500mg BID for one week

options.label: B
options.text: Admit in ward and give Levofloxacin orally 750mg OD + Inj. Ceftriaxone 1G IV BID for one week

options.label: C
options.text: Admit in ICCU and give Inj. Ceftriaxone 2G IV OD + IV levofloxacin 750mg OD for one week

options.label: D
options.text: Piperacillin + tazobactam 4.5 G qid for one week

questions.correct_answer: A. OP treatment with Clarithromycin 500mg BID for one week

questions.text: Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis from this x-ray?

A 62-year-old woman is evaluated in the pulmonary clinic for a persistent dry cough and worsening dyspnea on exertion over an 18-month period. On exam, her oxygen saturation is 96% breathing air and falls to 90% when she walks around the clinic. She has crepitations on auscultation of the bilateral lower lung elds but no other significant findings. A chest radiograph shows low lung volumes and reticular opacities in the bilateral lower lobes, while a chest CT scan shows honeycombing and alveolar septal thickening in the bilateral lower lobes. Which of the following patterns would you expect to see on pulmonary function testing in this patient?
The most common causative organism for lobar pneumonia is
Which of the following is a known consequence of asbestos exposure?

options.label: A
options.text: Mesothelioma is the most common cancer associated with asbestosis

options.label: C
options.text: Smoking does not increase the risk of lung cancer in those with asbestos exposure

options.label: D
options.text: An obstructive pattern, typically revealed by pulmonary function testing

questions.correct_answer: B. Pleural effusions, often initially benign

questions.text: This patient came with chronic productive cough and clubbing and coarse rales. What is the diagnosis of the CT Scan below :
A 30 year old presented with features of acute pancreatitis. Few days later he developed dyspnea. His chest Xray is shown below. The probable respiratory failure is ?

A 75 /M admitted in ICU for 5 days developed sudden onset dyspnea with chest pain. D dimer is positive . CT angiography shows pulmonary artery thrombus. BP is 70/50 mmHg. Anticoagulation with unfractionated heparin is administered. After a fluid bolus of 1 L, the patient’s blood pressure remains low at 88/50 mmHg. Echocardiogram demonstrates hypokinesis of the right ventricle. On 100% non-rebreather mask, the SaO2 is 92%. What is the next best step in management of this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Continue IV fuids at 500 mL/hr for a total of 4 L of fluid resuscitation and refer to surgical embolectomy.

options.label: C
options.text: Refer for inferior vena cava filter placement and continue current management.

options.label: D
options.text: Treat with dopamine and recombinant tissue plasminogen activator, 100 mg IV

questions.correct_answer: D. Treat with dopamine and recombinant tissue plasminogen activator, 100 mg IV

questions.text: A 28 year old actress presented with a four week history of breathlessness. She had returned from Himalayan trekking six weeks ago. She had no cough but had intermittent chest tightness and had been started on Salbutamol with no improvement. Results showed a normal Chest X-ray, ECG and spirometry. Oxygen saturations were 99% on air at rest and after walking up a flight of stairs. Her ABG Shows Ph ; 7.50 , Pao2 : 94 mmhg , Paco2 : 28 mmhg , HCO3- : 20 meq /L . What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 28 / F , with grade II (NYHA) Primary Pulmonary hypertension , the vasoreactive test was negative . Which of the following is considered as initial treatment ?
All of following features are seen in the viral pneumonia except :

options.label: D
options.text: Multinucleate giant cells in the bronchiolar wall

questions.text: A 65-year-old male smoker has been diagnosed with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD). On pulmonary function testing, the FEV1/FVC < 0.7 and FEV1 = 42% of predicted. The severity of airflow obstruction in this patient as per Gold criteria is:
A 40-year-old patient of bronchial asthma presented with acute severe breathlessness. Indications for giving him assisted ventilation for acute severe asthma include which of following?

options.label: A
options.text: PaO2 < 80 mm of Hg. PaCO2, <45 of Hg

options.label: B
options.text: PaO2, > 60 mm of Hg, PaCO2, > 45 of Hg

options.label: C
options.text: PaO2, <60 mm of Hg, PaCO2, > 45 of Hg

options.label: D
options.text: PaO2, <80 mm of Hg, PACO2, > 45 of Hg

questions.correct_answer: C. PaO2, <60 mm of Hg, PaCO2, > 45 of Hg

questions.text: Which one of the following is not a usual cause of Type-2 respiratory failure?
Extensively drug resistant TB (XDR-TB) is MDR/RR-TB and are also resistant to any fluoroquinolone (levofloxacin or moxifloxacin) and

options.label: A
options.text: At least one additional group A drug (either bedaquiline or linezolid [or both])

options.label: C
options.text: At least one group B drug ( either clofazimine or cycloserine or both

options.label: D
options.text: At least one additional group c drug (either Delamanid or amikacin [or both]).

questions.correct_answer: A. At least one additional group A drug (either bedaquiline or linezolid [or both])

questions.text: A 50-year-old stone crusher with an unremarkable previous medical history reports progressive dyspnoea & long?standing cough with whitish sputum since 3 months. He had no fever, chills, weight loss, night sweats, and other symptoms. The chest CT is shown below. Which one of the following is the most appropriate diagnostic evaluation to perform next?

A 65/M presents with progressive SOB. Other than a H/O of heavy tobacco use, the patient has a benign past medical history. The trachea appears to be deviated more towards the right. Percussion of the right chest reveals DULLNESS. Breath sounds are absent two thirds of the way up on the right side of the chest. CXR is shown . Which of the following diagnoses is most likely?

A 45/M had COVID pneumonia with spo2 85 % & had to be intubated for ARDS. His Neutrophil / Lymphocyte ratio is 7, CRP is 80 ug /mL , ferritin 1000ng /ml & D-dimer : 0.6 ug/ml. The ventilator settings are tidal volume 600 mL and frequency 15 /min. He weighs 60 kg. His chest True regarding management is :

options.label: A
options.text: Avoid sedation and neuromuscular blockade as pt is in respiratory failure

options.label: B
options.text: Prone positioning is not indicated as pt is intubated

options.label: D
options.text: Decrease ventilator frequency to 10 breaths per min

questions.correct_answer: C. Decrease tidal volume to 360 mL

questions.text: A 35-year-old female was admitted with acute dyspnoea, 12 months after the birth of her second child. During the past 6 months, she has suffered from dyspnoea despite the fact that she has never smoked. Chest radiography revealed a unilateral pneumothorax, which was treated appropriately. The follow-up CT scan is shown below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

True regarding pleural effusion is/are : a. Normal chest wall expansion on diseased side b. Stony dullness on percussion c. Coarse Crepitations heard on auscultation d. Air bronchogram is not the classical radiological finding. Select the right combination

options.label: A
options.text: If a, b, c are correct

options.label: B
options.text: If a and c are correct

options.label: C
options.text: If b and d are correct

options.label: D
options.text: If all four (a, b, c, & d) are correct

questions.correct_answer: C. If b and d are correct

questions.text: Regarding Invasive Pulmonary Aspergillosis all are true except :

options.label: A
options.text: More than 80% of invasive disease cases involve the lungs; in pts who are significantly immunocompromised

options.label: B
options.text: A. fumigatus is responsible for most cases of invasive aspergillosis

options.label: C
options.text: Halo signs are present late in the course of infection in neutropenic patients

questions.correct_answer: C. Halo signs are present late in the course of infection in neutropenic patients

questions.text: Identify disease in a pt. who was treated for TB previously who came for a routine check up :

A 54 / M farmer , non smoker complains of recurrent SOB after working in a storage house where hay is present. On auscultation there are bilateral crepts . His blood investigations are normal. His CXR is showing bilateral lower zone infiltrates . He denies any previous h/o of allergies Which of the following statements is NOT correct regarding the disease ?

options.label: A
options.text: Decreased risk of developing in smoker

options.label: D
options.text: A common histologic feature in HP is the presence of noncaseating granulomas

questions.correct_answer: C. Symptoms occur immediately after exposure.

questions.text: A 75/M is referred for dyspnoea on exertion and chronic cough that have worsened progressively over the past 12 months. PFT shows restriction with DLCO of 38% predicted. The chest radiograph shows bilateral patchy infltrates, mostly at the lung bases. HRCT is shown below. What is the most appropriate therapy for this patient?
Which of the following is true regarding non specific interstitial pneumonia

A 26-year-old female was referred to you from a dermatologist for evaluation of chronic dry cough. She first visited dermatologist for painful skin lesion over lower limbs as shown below. She was given symptomatic treatment with NSAIDS without any relief. She was not on any oral steroids. No other respiratory symptoms or GI symptoms. No fever, weight loss or any other systemic symptoms. Her CXR is given below. Hypercalcaemia and lymphopenia are the only abnormal laboratory tests. All are true regarding the condition except ?

options.label: C
options.text: Biopsy of involved organ can show granulomas

options.label: D
options.text: The most commonly used method for detecting lung disease is chest roentgenogram

questions.correct_answer: A. Spontaneous remission does not occur.

questions.text: A 65 year old male , heavy smoker with lung cancer presents with SOB , hemoptysis headache and following general examination features . Which one of following is the most probable histology of lung cancer?

A 60 /y male, smoker was diagnosed with lung cancer recently . He now complains of right sided chest pain, tingling and weakness of intrinsic muscles of his right hand and drooping of right upper eyelid . His CXR PA and facial features are given below. Which one of the following complications of lung cancer is most likely cause ?

A 32 /M with Sputum CBNAAT confirmed Rifampicin sensitive tuberculosis and was started on daily regimen 2HRZE + 4HRE . His subsequent report showed Isoniazid resistance . Now what will be the treatment regimen for this patient according to NTEP guidelines ?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient should be started on bedaquiline based DRTB regimen

options.label: B
options.text: Isoniazid should be replaced by moxiflox and treated for 9 months

options.label: C
options.text: Patient to be started on levofloxacin +RZE regimen for 6 months

options.label: D
options.text: Isoniazid can be removed from the regimen and rest of the primary regimen to be given for 12 months.

questions.correct_answer: C. Patient to be started on levofloxacin +RZE regimen for 6 months

questions.text: In the newly recommended oral longer regimen for Multi Drug Resistant TB (MDR TB), what is the drug that not a part of the usual treatment regimen?
The following condition is not associated with an increased anion gap type of metabolic acidosis

An 44-year-old female with diarrhoea was found to have a blood pressure of 100/60 mmHg, heart rate 101beats/min, temperature 37.8°C. Laboratory data are obtained: sodium 137 meq/L, potassium 2.8meq/L,, chloride 117 meq/L, BUN 17 mg/dL, creatinine 0.9 mg/dL. ABG shows pH 7.29, PCO2 24 mmHg, HCO3 10 meq/L. What is the acid-base disorder?

options.label: C
options.text: Normal anion-gap metabolic acidosis and compensatory respiratory alkalosis

options.label: D
options.text: Mixed metabolic acidosis and respiratory alkalosis

questions.correct_answer: C. Normal anion-gap metabolic acidosis and compensatory respiratory alkalosis

questions.text: All of the following are chloride responsive causes of metabolic alkalosis except

A young female presented to emergency department with breathing difficulty. Her ABG Ph : 7.52 PaCO2 : 27mmhg HCO3- : 22 meq. Her systemic examination was normal except for carpopedal spasm . What will be next line of management?
questions.correct_answer: C. Breathing into a paper bag

questions.text: Which of the following drug is known to decrease mortality in critically ill COVID pt ?
A 56 year old coal mine worker presented with joint pains and occasional cough with dyspnoea. His chest x-ray showed multiple small nodules in both lungs. Most likely diagnosis is:
Which of the following is not a part of definition of ARDS?
Regarding Pneumocystis pneumonia in HIV-infected patients all are true except?

options.label: A
options.text: Most patients have CD4 counts <200 at the time of diagnosis of their first episode PCP

options.label: B
options.text: Most patients with PCP will have an elevated serum lactate dehydrogenase level.

options.label: C
options.text: ABG can reveal PaO2 < 60mm of hg and a widened alveolo-arterial gradient

options.label: D
options.text: A normal chest radiograph rules out the diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: D. A normal chest radiograph rules out the diagnosis

questions.text: A 60 / M , HEAVY SMOKER bronchogenic carcinoma presenting with polyuria, pain abdomen, nausea, vomiting, altered sensorium with the below chest xray .The histological variant can be mostly
All are true regarding ILD except :

options.label: A
options.text: Most forms of ILD will eventually result in a restrictive deficit on pulmonary function testing

options.label: B
options.text: IPF is the most common ILD of unknown cause

options.label: C
options.text: The most common granulomatous ILD is Hypersensitivity pneumonitis

options.label: D
options.text: ILD is the most common pulmonary manifestation of Systemic sclerosis

questions.correct_answer: C. The most common granulomatous ILD is Hypersensitivity pneumonitis
